intro: Orthogynium, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Orthogynium goniocalyx, which is native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a distinctive, broad shape with a smooth or slightly toothed margin. Orthogynium is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
